result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark James Fossell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any cash bail on deposit shall be applied to costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Remaining balance shall be returned to surety.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 2 in 22CF1124. Huber for work and treatment.

On 6/7/2022:  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms, ammunnition or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised that the defendant wil have to provide a DNA sampe to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Decision And Order Denying Motion For Electronic Monitoring

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Electronic Monitoring
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief - received
Per clerical error.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Court finds State has complied with victim rights legislation.  
Sentencing statements by the defendant.
8 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to COUNT 2 in 22CF1124; 8 DAYS Credit; Huber for: work and treatment.  

Any cash bond on deposit shall be applied to costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges. Remaining balance shall be returned to the surety.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 THROUGH 7 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody for sentencing.   All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to the Court, Filed.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Supplements, Filed.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court, defendant Mark James Fossell not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Mark James Fossell in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Defendant Mark James Fossell in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Arguments heard by state and defense. For reasons stated on the record, Court takes no action on bail. All conditions remain the same. Discovery and global offer received. Defense requests more time to review offer with client. 5/27 scheduling conference remains set.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.
E-mailed parties to set up immediate bail review date. Defendant at HOC. Zoom appearance arranged with HOC by the clerk.
Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 05-09-2022.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court, defendant Mark James Fossell not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant in custody, not produced.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense advises he has not receiced discovery and requests a scheduling date.  Defendant to be in person on the next date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
At Court's request, case will be scheduled for bail/bond hearing.  Parties notified on the record on case 22CF1402. Case scheduled for 4/22/2022 at 1:30 pm, Br. 25.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  bm
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (New Criminal Charges), filed.  Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Mark J Fossell in court with Attorney Thomas J. Schneck; both appear by video.  Defendant Mark J Fossell in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Cudahy Detective A. Ayala. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  State to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

NCO w Geographic Restrictions Other Conditions signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order With Geographic Restrictions/Other Conditions.   IT IS ORDERED, as a condition of the defendant's release, that the defendant;  
not possess or attempt to possess any dangerous weapons
have no contact with the area within the physical boundaries set for below:
Northern border : East Grange Avenue
Southern border : East Ramsey Avenue
Western border : South Illinois Avenue
Eastern border : South Packard Avenue
No contact with Jennifer F, or her residence located at 5728 S Elaine Avenue, Cudahy, WI

Defendant Mark J Fossell in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Mark J Fossell in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark J Fossell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
